definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Learn the rules so you know how to break them properly.
sentences.chinese: 先弄懂规则，才会知道该如何适切地打破成规。

sentences.english: Why do we have to stick to conventions and dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么要墨守成规，不敢越雷池一步呢？

sentences.english: He showed little initiative, handling all matters strictly by the book.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏首创精神，墨守成规地办一切事情。

sentences.english: You will never change their ideas. They are far too hidebound .
sentences.chinese: 你无法改变他们的意思，因为他们太墨守成规。

sentences.english: Unlucky people tend to be creatures of routine.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的人往往是默守成规的产物。

sentences.english: These breakthrough the traditional story ruts which thinking much of polt and narrating single angle.
sentences.chinese: 这些突破了传统小说重情节，叙述角度单一的成规。

sentences.english: Ted is a real stick- in- the- mud.
sentences.chinese: 特德真是个墨守成规的人。

definition: to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
old system/weights and measures of former times
lit. carpenter's straight line marker/same as 墨斗/fig. rules/rules and regulations
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
to hold tight/to cling to/to adhere/stubborn/to detain sb as prisoner
